name: Desert Slime
description: The Desert Slime resembles ordinary sand when still, making it difficult to detect. It can squeeze through narrow spaces and blend in with its environment.
memorable: Its ability to restrain and damage foes while blending into the environment makes the Desert Slime a unique combat threat.
goals: The Desert Slime aims to ambush and incapacitate creatures that come too close, utilizing its stealth.
relations: It may be encountered in arid or sandy environments, often found lurking among dunes or desert ruins.
environment: Arid environments, particularly deserts and sandy areas.
strengths: Immunity to acid and fire damage; blending into the environment; unique restrained condition attack.
weaknesses: Low Armor Class makes it easy to hit; poor Dexterity affects agility.
attacks: Pseudopod attack deals bludgeoning and acid damage, with a significant restraining ability.
most_powerful_ability: The 'Mire' ability can permanently restrain and damage a target, making it a serious danger.
senses: It has blindsight out to 60 feet, enabling it to detect creatures without relying on sight.
skills: Has a passive Perception score of 10.
additional_information: Can occupy the same space as another creature, creating difficult terrain.
Does not require sleep, making it a constant threat.
Can move through spaces that are at least 1 foot wide without hindrance.
False Appearance trait allows it to disguise as ordinary sand.
Can only restrain one creature at a time with its Mire ability.
